website_summaries.verdict: A compact tool that has all the essential functions you need for common repairs on the road.
pros: Comes with a neoprene carrying bag
Leaves you plenty of space in the saddle bag for tire repair items
Handy enough to be used for repairs at home, too
cons: The steel construction on these tools makes them prone to rusting over time

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for tightening crank arms on the go
customer_reviews.text: Some reviews mentioned that the tool is too small. Umm, clearly some people have trouble reading that this is a mini-tool. Topeak is a reputable company, and the tool was created for people like me, who use their bike to commute to work, or, like me, have had heavier "real" tools stolen that were kept on the bike while locked up at the train station. The main functions I was looking for were ability to tighten crank arms and light weight (to be carried with me on the train daily). After I replaced my crank arms, the left one loosens occasionally (which is common). This tool fits the bill perfectly for the need to tighten that arm on occasion.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Best compact and light weight multitool I own
customer_reviews.text: This is hands down the best multitool I own. I have a couple of other ones but they're too bulky and heavy for my rides. However, this one is extremely light and stronger than the others. It may not have a million parts but this has all the basic tools you need as a cyclist. It hardly takes up any space and barely adds any weight to my bike ride. My only complaint is that the 8mm allen adapter is slightly loose, so make sure you don't lose that.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Little in size but big on usefulness
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect tool to have in your kit while cycling. Has just about everything you'd need to make adjustments or light repairs on the trail. It doesn't take up much space, either. Comes with a little carrying case that you can ditch to make it fit even better. Each tool feels sturdy and secure while applying torque and the whole thing is just really well made. I highly recommend this for cheap insurance when your miles from anywhere and just need to tighten up your handlebars or seat post.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: well built and super small
customer_reviews.text: The mini 9 is very small and feels like it is made of good quality. It's good for emergencies while out on a ride, but it's not ideal as a home use tool. For what it is and what it costs, it's well built, small and lightweight and I believe deserves 5 stars provided you know it's not a tool that would be used everyday at home or in a shop since it's not very comfortable in the hands due to it's very small and compact nature..
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the road
customer_reviews.text: As many other reviews indicated, this is indeed small tool but packs everything you need other than fixing your chain. I haven't had to use it yet as I've just received it but looking at the construction, I think it will handle job well in emergency out on the road. It's got some heft to it but considering 9 mini tools, that's reasonable. Comes with a nylon case which is good so it won't snag inside your saddle bag. Overall I am very satisfied but if I had to do it again may opt for the kit with chain tool included. I do recommend this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Hue Chau

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool!
customer_reviews.text: Just getting into biking so I didn’t know what I really need. I was buying everything ! I was thinking I needed to most expensive or the latest greatest. This simple tool is all you need for quick adjustments on your rides. Anything more serious you would probably need to take it to the shop. Tool is smaller than it looks online but it works. Topeak products are top notch !
customer_reviews.author: UGADawg

customer_reviews.title: What a great tool to adjust/fix your bike!
customer_reviews.text: I have NO idea why I did not buy this much earlier. I was always struggling around looking for allen wrenches etc when I had to adjust various things in my bike. I can' t recommend this tool enough. It is small and easy to keep in the van when we go around biking in the trails and fix on the fly.
customer_reviews.author: NJ Nerd

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: This thing is built to last! I bought it for my biking pack, but I find myself using it around the house, hiking, or for other casual uses as well. It's so small, but so strong. It's nice for tightening things in small spaces too. But mainly, this is the best biking tool for me, it does exactly what I need it to and it fits perfectly in its case in my bag. Could also very easily fit in your pocket. 10/10 in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Koegel

customer_reviews.title: The best tool for most cyclists
customer_reviews.text: This really is the perfect little multi tool. Wirecutter listed it as the best for most cyclists, and I would agree. It's easier to use than the boxy style tools, with every bit one could possibly need for on road repair, in a compact, very lightweight design. I just bought 5 more a year later, to give to all my closest cycling friends, for Xmas.
customer_reviews.author: Camp RunamokTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: too small to be very useful
customer_reviews.text: We should have bought something larger. It's better than nothing, but we are fortunate to have always been with someone that had a better tool when we needed it. It's not just that there are limited tools, it's not large enough to get much torque. So even when we had the right size, there were times we just could not loosen a piece! With a larger tool set, that little bit of extra torque made a huge difference. So it probably is better than nothing, but we'll be buying something larger.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: High-quality minimalist tool
customer_reviews.text: Not quite as small as I expected, but I also wasn't aware it included a small pouch. Now that stays permanently on the belt of the shorts I bike in. I know this product doesn't have as many tools as some other choices, but this is perfect for an always-available set of wrenches. I hear the chain breaker, tire lever, and other parts of bigger tools are not that great anyway, and the necessity to keep a patch kit and other stuff on longer rides means using a bag anyway. I haven't had to use it yet, hopefully it doesn't let me down. I consider this unlikely, the thing feels very solid.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Zorn

customer_reviews.title: I can finally tighten my kid's kickstand
customer_reviews.text: I needed the correctly sized hex bolt to tighten my kid's kickstand. this did the job, plus adds other cycle-specific tools, if needed. It's small enough to carry around in a small bike pouch. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Rob B.

customer_reviews.title: Just used it today to do a couple repairs on my bike and it does a nice job.
customer_reviews.text: Having this little tool on a long ride or in your backpack is an awesome feature. I adjusted my brakes, fixed the shifter cables, and minor adjustments on my road bike such as seat height and seat position. This thing is pretty small (smaller than what I expected) but it does everything I need it to do. It is solid and I don't see it braking anytime soon. A mini solid tool to have and it has all the major functions you need to have when something brakes down. It may not have all the "super tools" like spokes, etc but this thing is sure handy!! Happy I bought it, its going in my backpack which I ride with.
customer_reviews.author: A to Z Guarantee

customer_reviews.title: First one was stolen so I went and bought another
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty much the perfect toolset for a short ride. It has screwdrivers for derailleurs and disc brakes and hex keys for all the common sizes you'll find on a bike. If you're riding longer distances you should add a chain tool and a spoke wrench. It comes in a handy pouch which stops it from grabbing everything in your saddle bag as you pull it out. It's easy to open - no more broken thumb nails trying to pry it open. The only improvement they could make is to cut a spoke wrench into the frame My last one was stolen so I replaced it the same day. I didn't even consider replacing it with something else.
customer_reviews.author: Math AddictTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for local singletrack
customer_reviews.text: Just the right size. I'll never need more than this on the trails I ride as I am never more that 10 miles away from a main road. If I was doing long rides deep into the woods, I would want more.
customer_reviews.author: Guy from Mt P

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Great tool kit. Better than the 6 version just because for only 3 more options it is pretty much the same size. Cons, mine is very tight to open and close but it can be fixed. Pros, very small size. Perfect for my mountain bike rides every week.
customer_reviews.author: Wackeystar

customer_reviews.title: A tiny, light, super useful multi-tool for bicyclists
customer_reviews.text: This little multi-tool has already saved my butt a handful of times while cycling with minimal baggage: When I first got clipless pedals, they needed to be adjusted on the fly, and this tool made simple work of it; my commuter rack came loose, and this tool was there to help me tighten it; I swapped out my pedals for flats on the road, and this tool made it happen. It has just the right combo of allen wrenches and other tools for most bicyclist needs, and it's light and tiny and seems to be well built.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Bush

customer_reviews.title: Compact and well designed
customer_reviews.text: This small tool with its own pouch is very useful. Easy to stow in bike bag and has enough assorted tools to handle many tasks, such as adjustments. Best to carry small adjustable wrench too.
customer_reviews.author: Anders

customer_reviews.title: A
customer_reviews.text: Finally got the tool set after failure from the first time but only time will tell if the tools are sturdy for long term but love the size!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Compact, strong.
customer_reviews.text: Used it quite a bit already. Compact, strong, doesn't flex when tightening bolts. Handy carrying case. Small enough to fit in my already full saddle bag. Only negative is it is really tight making it hard to open and close. But I think I just need to loosen the allen bolt.
customer_reviews.author: Damian N

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, but pouch went backwards
customer_reviews.text: I've had the Mini 9 for over 10 years. Its perfect for my bike, and so tiny it'll fit anywhere. And one of strongest mini-tools I've ever owned. BUT... now that I bought a 2nd one to keep with my scooter, I realized the included pouch no longer has a belt strap loop on the back. That was super handy to attach this tool to anything: belt, bag, or bike itself.
customer_reviews.author: Cupcakes

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: This multitool is small and relatively light weight, and the case that it comes with seems well constructed. The tool itself seems sturdy. However, when you open some of the individual tools, it often raises up others with it, which are then difficult to press back down. At the same time, the smaller tools are extremely difficult to raise up to a point where you can use them. I'm not entirely sure what the other multitool options are like, but if I lost this one I'd probably buy something different to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Dean

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy AF
customer_reviews.text: Nothing feels remotely flimsy. There isn't any noticeable play as you tension the keys, and this thing is pretty small. I love it so far! It comes with a nice cushion pouch that seems like it might be water resistant (neoprene-like), so it adds some impact and hopefully some moisture protection. It is sort of dense, so not heavy but for it's size it feels like a solidly constructed piece of metal. In my eyes this is a good thing because it seems well-built.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Neat little tool
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned about the durability of this smaller unit, but it held up fine for the whole summer of cycling. One shortfall that I overlooked was it doesn't have a allen wrench size to fit my seat angle adjustment, so I carry another allen wrench just for that. Otherwise, this unit worked well for me. I ended up losing it on the side of the trail one hot day while I had my bike bag opened to change a flat tube. The neoprene carrying case it nice, especially if you carry a smartphone loose in your bike bag too. You won't have to worry about scratching up your screen.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Great product for them Bikes
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased a Bicycle and this will be great for any small repairs on my Mountain Bicycle!
customer_reviews.author: Carlos H. Davila Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Small but functional
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Just used it to assemble a Schwinn bike. No problems. High quality steel in the bits.
customer_reviews.author: Richard G. Rawlins

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work with My Bike
customer_reviews.text: I have a pretty standard bicycle and none of these would fit any of the screws on my bike. Not sure how anyone's using this thing. Make sure it can be used on your bike when you order. It's also a lot smaller than I expected it to be. Literally so tiny.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Maou

customer_reviews.title: I use it almost weekly
customer_reviews.text: Handle little tool. I pretty must use it for everything I can. It never leaves the bike pouch.
customer_reviews.author: drater

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Tool
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great. I have an older Trek Navigator 3.0 and it appears to work on every screw on the bike. The only drawback is that the case doesn’t have a belt loop or clip in it, but that’s no big deal. Otherwise, it’s perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So Darned Useful
customer_reviews.text: It's like the second I got this, suddenly I'm needing it all the time. I use it for just about everything on my bike, almost every day. Quality is reassuring... it feels like serious business. I'm very happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Eric L.

customer_reviews.title: very good but falls slightly short on design
customer_reviews.text: I love how small this product is. It has an amazing number of tools for its size, comes with its own carrying case, and seems to be quite durable. The only problem I can see is the tools do not have a locked position or even a maximum angle of extension anywhere less than about 330 degrees. I have used it to disassemble and reassemble a small desk fan and found the non locking movement of the individual tools made it all slightly more difficult but I am still quite happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: scaredofspiders

customer_reviews.title: Not rust proof.
customer_reviews.text: This is mostly for emergencies, so I don't use it much outside of seat adjustments sometimes. It got a little rusty after a couple months but still very useful. It was just in its case in my saddle bag, so I don't know.
customer_reviews.author: dngn0

customer_reviews.title: Nice product!
customer_reviews.text: Nice tool. It doesn’t take up much room in my under seat pouch and I feel better about taking long trips with the bike.
customer_reviews.author: Andi M.

customer_reviews.title: Great little, high quality tool
customer_reviews.text: Everyone should carry one of these or a similar one in their bicycle equipment bag. Riding about 27 hours a week, I have often had need to do a bit of minor maintenance on my or another's bike, and this tool has the ones typically needed. As are all Topeak products, this one is of very high quality, easily stored, and comes with its own little case. I probably have an example of most multiple tools sitting in my tool box at home, but this is the one I actually carry on my bicycle.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Scott

customer_reviews.title: Small, Lightweight, and Well-Built
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for the saddle bag! It's small, but functional, and easy to use. It's lightweight, but strong; I don't feel as though it is going to bend or break when torquing a bolt. And the fact that it comes with a neoprene carrying case is a bonus! Topeak has a range of tools, and I would suggest anyone interested in this tool may want to consider the Mini 10 and Mini 6. This tool has a sizes than I can use on my road bike, so the Mini 6 might be just as useful. Likewise, if you have lots of different sized fasteners, there's the Mini 10. Overall, it's a well-built, small, and lightweight tool that does the job!
customer_reviews.author: Anton

customer_reviews.title: Great basic tool, but consider Hexus II model
customer_reviews.text: This tool is great and provides a lot of function for its size. I ended up returning mine because the 8mm adapter head would not stay on the hex key with spring-loaded ball. Must have just been a tolerance issue on the adapter head. Great for minimalists bikers, but I highly recommend the Hexus II model for only a few more dollars. It has a chain breaker, chain clip, and tire levers.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Please buy this product so you don't get stranded in the mountains like we almost did
customer_reviews.text: This little device my friends and I call "The Bean" has saved us in the middle of the mountains on trails that are hardcore. It has all of the tools needed for a bike. Please buy this product so you don't get stranded in the mountains like we almost did.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Clark

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Don't leave home without it. Know how to use it. Drink water. Don't feed the bears.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo

customer_reviews.title: Compact, sturdy little tool
customer_reviews.text: Good combination of diffferent tools, compact design at reasonable weight. Feels like solid quality when using it.
customer_reviews.author: The Shoppper

customer_reviews.title: So cuuute :) Yed solid and usable.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so cute :) Seriously, it's tiny. Shorter than a pack of Wrigley's chewing gum. Yet, it feels solid, has certain heft to it that gives it a quality feel. Despite the size it has enough leverage to undo or tighten any bolts on my bikes. But don't expect it to be a shop tool. This is for well working bikes with properly lubed bolts. Don't expect it to undo a rusty 10 years old bolt with this. Also, due to the size it may not reach bolts that are located deep, out of reach. For my needs it's perfect though.
customer_reviews.author: AdamDZ

customer_reviews.title: Great small size, good quality
customer_reviews.text: Great size for small bike bag. Good selection of tools. Seems more durable and higher quality than other inexpensive multi-tools I have bought. Will buy another for other bike bag.
customer_reviews.author: P N

customer_reviews.title: Small and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Small and you can take on carryon on a plane but you need to show it to the TSA (no cutting edge allowed) worked fine for my bike tour.
customer_reviews.author: lance corbin

customer_reviews.title: Better than crankbrothers
customer_reviews.text: So far this hasn't broken on me but my crankbrothers did during a ride.
customer_reviews.author: Sal

customer_reviews.title: Nice, light tool.  Just one gripe
customer_reviews.text: So, this is a great tool, I know there is no perfect tool for every situation. I just am always adjusting my seat. It's never, just right. This has the tool for my seat on the end. It's the one with the adapter on top. I can't spin it on my seat adjustment. It hits the post after 1/3 of a turn at best. I lose my seat's position when I'm doing it myself. Just nit picking here, but I wish that tool was in the middle.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Great little package if you don't need a chain tool
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than I expected. Light weight. The 8 mm hex head detaches so you have to be careful not to lose it (it shouldn't come off on its own.) Mine tools were slightly hard to pull apart from each other. I sprayed some silicon spray around the "hinge" area to help make it easier.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Not as many uses and features but still worth carrying.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent mini tool for very minor repairs and adjustments. It's best suited for someone that does training rides or short commutes not too far away from home. It will help in most situations but without a chain tool or a flat head screwdriver it's a bit limited. Considering it's size and weight it's very easy to carry and more useful than a bigger, heavier tool that you might end up leaving at home.
customer_reviews.author: Emmanuel

customer_reviews.title: very nice small multitool
customer_reviews.text: This is a very functional ultralight multi-tool, especially for this price and size. Some of the smaller tools have tools that are too small to be useful. The included carrying case is very useful to keep the tool from rubbing against inner tubes and other fragile items in your pocket or seat bag.
customer_reviews.author: l2Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: It actually performs 10 functions.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a tool that would perform at least 9 functions but not add too many ounces to my bicycle load-out. I have a modified Trek 24 speed and have removed as many ounces from the frame as possible without compromising the structural integrity of the bike, so when it came to choosing a multi-tool, I wanted to make sure that it wouldn't weight me down and reduce my performance on the road trail. This tool fit the bill.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Ramos

customer_reviews.title: great tool
customer_reviews.text: the tool itself is great. The little tool holder itself had flimsy stitching on the velcro
customer_reviews.author: octopussoup

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight but well-constructed
customer_reviews.text: This is a very useful tool that goes with me on every ride.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey L. Crooke

customer_reviews.title: ... multi tool for my bike that is light and easy to fit just about anywhere
customer_reviews.text: Very handy multi tool for my bike that is light and easy to fit just about anywhere. I've only been riding for 3 weeks and I already had to use it in the middle of a ride to re-tighten my handle bars.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S. Morrison

customer_reviews.title: ...the apple of bike tools.
customer_reviews.text: Love this tool! I can carry this in my jersey pocket and forget its there. Tool works great on my 2012 Cannondale Super Six Its like the like the apple of bike tools. Refined design to simple and effective tool Pros: Compact, Light, Small, Strong, Perfect tool for road biking Cons: None!
customer_reviews.author: nolilyan4u

customer_reviews.title: Tiny, functional, perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I've got two of these - one for my road bike and one that goes in my camelback. I lost one on the trail once, I bought another the next day. That should tell you how much I rely on them. Don't bother with those huge tools that include a chain link removal tool. Get separate, quality Park chain tool instead, and use this for everything else. If I had any gripes, I could use one more attachment - a flat length of metal with cutouts for common bolt sizes. Other than that, I highly recommend this essential piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Simian Int'l

customer_reviews.title: So far only one tool on this has come to my aid...
customer_reviews.text: ...and that is the hex that fits the screws for my water holder. As luck would have it, my pedals are 6mm hex and not 8mm like what comes with the tool. Overall this tool is solid, economical and compact. It comes w/ its own little carrying case, too. Perfect if you're traveling light and just want something for emergencies that you can carry easily in a clothing pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: essential
customer_reviews.text: I have the Topeak Mini-6 tool and love it so I thought I'd give this one a try with another bike. It's bigger than the mini-six but still very small. It has most of the tools you would need in an emergency and for $13 it's very well made. The mini-9 is only $1 more than the Mini-6 and not much bigger so if you have the space just get this one.
customer_reviews.author: PC MountainTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for compact road kit
customer_reviews.text: I am always trying to reduce the size and weight of things I carry with me on my road bike (Giant TCR Advanced). The tools needed to make minor adjustments or repairs are at a minimum: Mini Frame Pump, Spare Tube, Tire Levers, Speed Patches and now the Topeak Mini 9-Function Bicycle Tool. This tool handles all the normal adjustments and is really small and light weight. If you're looking to go minimal with your seat-bag repair kit...I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Steven R. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Everything you need, nothing you don't
customer_reviews.text: Did you think you could find a set of all-purpose bike tools that costs $17, weighs under 100g, and somehow doesn't suck? I didn't. Yet here we are. It's the real deal. I haven't had to open my "real" toolbox in months.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Berg

customer_reviews.title: Mighty mite.
customer_reviews.text: Have only used the Mini 9 a few times so far. It's definitely a tiny tool; so leverage is not its strongest attribute. Specialized tools with extended handles would have worked better. But for a small tool that will suffice for just about any job on the bike and that will not take up too much room in a seat bag, the Mini 9 is hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: Semper Grumpy

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than say the crankbrothers tool which is great but you're practically screwed if you leave with out ...
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than say the crankbrothers tool which is great but you're practically screwed if you leave with out a chain tool and you have an issue with your chain. Don't forget to cover all your bases one way or the other.
customer_reviews.author: photolinger

customer_reviews.title: Best multi tool without spoke wrenches or chain tool
customer_reviews.text: For those cyclist wanting the minimal tool requirements to get them home, this is it. If you don't want spoke wrenches or chain tool, or don't know how to use these latter tools, this will meet your requirements. Very small and very compact.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Marchand

customer_reviews.title: Just the right size for a compact tool!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased another mini tool that was a bit smaller and lighter than this. It was only good for tweaking tension or other really light duty things. Forget about the seatpost, pedals, and many other functions that require a bit of torque. This is smaller than my main tool, but big enough for almost any "on the road" need. Highly recommended for a small tool.
customer_reviews.author: jonohio

customer_reviews.title: perfect and small
customer_reviews.text: Super small--about 2 inches, and very light. I've only had to use it a few times to adjust brakes and a seat post, but it's done the job perfectly. I mount this on my saddle bag attached to one of the straps, and it sits perfectly. It also has the right size tool for fixing a garbage disposal, which is an added benefit :)
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: i bought it because i was riding my bike and the seat start to get loose. the tool arrived quickly and worked like a charm. not sure if i will need it again but it's small and comes with a nice little pouch so i'll stick it in my bag and just take it with me when i bike.
customer_reviews.author: tin

customer_reviews.title: ... functional enough when you're on the road with no better options. Packs well into a seat bag
customer_reviews.text: Tiny and functional enough when you're on the road with no better options. Packs well into a seat bag. Construction quality seems good.
customer_reviews.author: amazonreviewer123321

customer_reviews.title: Good tool, very useful
customer_reviews.text: Really great tool! I wish it came with a smaller phillips head (a really really tiny one) because I can't take apart my bike computer with it. But, I ended up losing the first bike tool I had (I accidentally kept my pack open during a ride and it fell out) so I purchased the same one, and purchased it again when I bought a new bike and wanted to always have a tool on me.
customer_reviews.author: Anomnomnom

customer_reviews.title: Handy little thing!
customer_reviews.text: This is not a be-all-end-all tool, but it basically does every kind of repair I'd ever attempt doing on the side of the road if I ran into problems. Not too heavy, but definitely a solid construction that will give you confidence when you really need to put some torque on something. Exactly what I was looking for in a commuter-support/trail support tool.
customer_reviews.author: David J. Gal

customer_reviews.title: amazing quality. One huge let down though
customer_reviews.text: amazing quality. One huge let down though: It works like a dream. Everybody in my group wants to borrow mine and people try to steal this off of me :( So result : I think someone stole it. I gotta buy another one but price it bit steep
customer_reviews.author: KyleChoi

customer_reviews.title: Simple Tool
customer_reviews.text: Well made biking tool. Light & compact, it is easily carried on the bike. I wire-tied it to the frame via the included neoprene case. I really only need two of the tools so didn't want the more common mega-tool. This one is as small as I could find. The steel tools are hard enough that they won't deform and the aluminum frame is stout enough to resist twisting.
customer_reviews.author: VA Duck

customer_reviews.title: I've used this mini-tool for many years; my recent ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used this mini-tool for many years; my recent purchase was to replace one that I lost. It has just the right assortment of tools for on-the-road bike use, without too much bulk and weight. The pouch fits snugly, and keeps the tool from abrading spare tubes or food bags. Everything you need, nothing you don't.
customer_reviews.author: Bernard M. Weinraub

customer_reviews.title: I use it all the time
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a "just in case" item for when I was out on the trail, but I've found myself using it quite a bit when not riding. It's perfect for adjusting brakes and derailleurs without having to dig out the toolbox. All the commonly used allen key sizes are included. The tool itself is sturdy and the carrying pouch is a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mueller

customer_reviews.title: LIked the first on so much, bought two more over the years.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought three. Two for my two bikes and one for my grown son. I have used this in the middle of nowhere and it can do almost anything you ask except heavy leveraged rusted bolts. Have had first one over a year and it is invaluable.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Moore

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic little handy tool set.
customer_reviews.text: Love it, it's definitely very tiny (literally fits in my denim vest front pocket) but packs a big punch and very strong and durable. I'm now able to tighten my saddle on the go and perform other basic mechanical procedures on my bike. Topeak is definitely a reliable company in general, though. Can't go wrong with them.
customer_reviews.author: DLeon86

customer_reviews.title: MUST HAVE
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! It always exactly what I need. Like when I flew over the handlebars of that Haro I just picked up! Loosey Goosey!! 👎
customer_reviews.author: Nico

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: Just the must-have tools to take on a bike ride "just in case." Very well put together and they do the job just fine. A bit stiff, which is great because then the tools you aren't using aren't flopping around and getting in the way.
customer_reviews.author: Sofia Leo

customer_reviews.title: Compact, sturdy, well built.
customer_reviews.text: This tool is absolutely awesome. Very compact, easy to use, well built, very great product. Only complaint is that there is no flathead screwdriver in the tool. Aside from this, I would hands down get this for all my cycling buddies who don’t already have a tool.
customer_reviews.author: SCB

customer_reviews.title: Perfect. Been looking for a multipurpose tool
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. Been looking for a multipurpose tool. been using my husbands bits and pieces. He doesn't ride, so he doesn't get it. I wanted my own tool and small enough to carry and not too heavy. This product fits the bill. It's perfect, works great, fits in my pack, love the carry case cover. Has all the parts I needed. I absolutely LOVE IT! Price is awesome. Might buy another one as a gift it is so cool!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Tiny, takes up hardly any space, gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: This thing takes up practically no space at all in my bag which is a huge bonus. I've used it a few times on the trail and it's a piece of cake to use and gives me no trouble. This thing is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy&Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Small and useful
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure there are 20 other reviews detailing how small, light, and versatile this multitool is, and how the nylon sheath is a great bonus. I just gave one as a gift to my partner and am really considering one for myself - seems a lot more compact than the three-way wrench I currently lug around
customer_reviews.author: amzemm

customer_reviews.title: Nice Commuter tool
customer_reviews.text: Handy little tool set. So far, I've only had to use it a few times but seems to have everything I need. It doesn't have a chain tool - but clearly I knew that before I bought it. It's nice and small - I keep it in my commuter bag for emergencies. Worth spending a few bucks on to throw in a bag.
customer_reviews.author: Freedonia

customer_reviews.title: Topeak mini 9 multi tool
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size, a bit larger than a box of matches. Has enough tools to tighten up minor issues on the road to keep you rolling. Comes w/ its own carrying case if you don't want to throw it in a seat bag. My only dig is it is a little thick. Recommended purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Good Minimalist Tool
customer_reviews.text: Lost my previous 6-Function Topeak when I forgot to zip my seat bag back up. Picked up this one and am not disappointed. It provides all of the utilityof a minimalist tool and easily fits in a 25cc bag along with an inflator, tube, and levers. Good for quick repairs on the road until you can get back home and do it right.
customer_reviews.author: RiK

customer_reviews.title: Great repair tool
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little tool. Lightweight and has all the needed tools for quick adjustments and repairs. Easy to fit in saddle bag for long rides. Price and delivery were fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Jess L.

customer_reviews.title: Has every bike tool except an air pump
customer_reviews.text: Only tool I needed to replace my handlebars entirely. That required 3 different sizes of allen wrench all of which this tool has. Pleased. I don't usually give 5 stars, but it's even smaller than I expected and still strong.
customer_reviews.author: tmg

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Bike Tool
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a tiny bicycle tool to keep in my bike bag. I have found this Topeak tool to be of good use both here in my own garage and on the road when I'm out riding. You never know when you might need to make an adjustment on a handlebar or the seat. Since it is so tiny, it is easy to keep with you.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Van Camp

customer_reviews.title: Always there just in case
customer_reviews.text: Small and handy this little tool is there when you need it. It works with the fittings on my bike just fine so I always have a tool just I case. Great purchase, worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool
customer_reviews.text: Great little tool, very compact and easy to use. Sometimes too small to get leverage for REALLY tight things, but perfect for on the trail adjustments. Is sturdy and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: I love this tool
customer_reviews.text: Lost mine so I had to get a new one. I love this tool. Very compact and easy to carry if even without a saddle bag. Has everything you need to do a quick repair minus a chain breaker and a 15mm wrench if you are running bolts and not QRs.
customer_reviews.author: kjames21

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice little tool, I really like it. It has all the needful widely-used hexes plus a cross screwdriver and a T25 torx as a bonus. I can't really think of any extra tools I normally need for relatively short rides. Only cross-country fans would need all the extra tools, I'm happy with this lightweight (just 26g) one.
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a buy
customer_reviews.text: It's a small nice thing, and I had it for at least 5 months and doesn't matter where I've put it or whatever happened, it acts and looks just as new, nice to touch, nice to carry. It's in my left pocket of backpack, so I just grab it when I need to screw/unscrew smth and put it back. It's designed to be used like that, in road situations. Obviously you need to use the each tool under 90 degrees, so that you can easily turn it. This is such a tool, that I think even any girl could easily use it (and be my potential wife lol)
customer_reviews.author: V. G.

customer_reviews.title: Hex keys are too short
customer_reviews.text: What good is the smallest sized hex key if it’s too short to reach the bolt. Can’t adjust the derailer on the fly because of this. Makes the tool useless in my case.
customer_reviews.author: Cheo1392

customer_reviews.title: All I need in a neat package.
customer_reviews.text: Good stuff, all the Allen keys and torx key I need in one place. Comes with a petite, cute neoprene case. I would have given five stars if it is made of stainless steel as I get caught in rain many times. Need my stuff to be as rust resistant as possible.
customer_reviews.author: Musician

customer_reviews.title: The best.
customer_reviews.text: Just what you need and gets in to tight spaces. I use this in my garage while working on bikes because my other tools just don't fit in tight spaces. I use this for racing as it's super light and compact. For longer rides I add a stand alone chain breaker.
customer_reviews.author: BaToChan

customer_reviews.title: all the tools you need
customer_reviews.text: I like this tool for everyday rides. It has all the adjustment tools you need for tuning your bike and it fits in your pocket or in a corner of your frame tube bag. I have several other multi tools that have spoke wrenches, chain crackers etc. but this is all you need.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Vader

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed and just like described
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived BEFORE the estimated arrival date and the item was just what I needed. The description was perfect and my item was perfect. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for midride fixes.
customer_reviews.text: I've got 2 of these - one on each bike I own. I use them both fairly frequently on rides to adjust derailleurs, saddle heights, and anything else I might need to fix. The tool is nice and compact, and fits in my saddle pouch without a hassle. It's a great, sturdy tool, and it's treated me well.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Bifulco

customer_reviews.title: Very compact and easy to carry in a small seat bag
customer_reviews.text: Take this with me on every ride and also use it at home for bike maintenance. Very compact and easy to carry in a small seat bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Everything you need, nothing you don't
customer_reviews.text: This product is impressively compact and light. It has all the essentials for biking repair and adjustments on the road. Construction is solid. Buy one and put it in you bag. You don't need an alien ().
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey A Scheidt

customer_reviews.title: Good tool
customer_reviews.text: This tool is pretty much exactly what you would expect. I do have one minor complaint. I needed a 6mm hex for my handlebars and the 6mm is the only one in this kit that is shorter than the rest (because of the 8mm attachment) so I had to buy another individual longer 6mm. But overall, it does the job and seems to be made well.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Tough little tool.
customer_reviews.text: This little thing is built solid. Only needed it once (knock on wood) and I was impressed. It really small and comes in a great little case.
customer_reviews.author: Skippy the Turtle

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: looks and feels of quality construction takes very little room in bike bag got almost every tool to work on bike, daily adjustments that is very happy with it and would recommend it for every one, you never know when your gonna need it.
customer_reviews.author: fun cuber
